html:
Exploring how AI is reshaping onboarding, user expectations, and product experiences.

Humans are becoming increasingly impatient when using products.

A study from the University of California found that the average time individuals focus on a single screen has decreased from 2.5 minutes in 2003 to just 47 seconds by 2020. For us as product builders, that means we have less than a minute to capture a user’s interest before they switch to something else.

In the current era of AI, things are getting even worse.

We used to buy books just to learn how to use Photoshop. We used to follow checklists, tooltips, and product tours to get started with SaaS products. But today, AI is changing customer expectations from “give me a tool where I can learn and create” to “do the work for me.” For example, instead of learning and creating work on Google Docs, Visual Studio Code, or Figma, we are now seeing a rise in AI doing the work for us with products like Bolt, V0, MidJourney, Cursor, Flora, and more.
